{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question describes a patient with a soft bulge inferior and lateral to the navel on the left side, which suggests a hernia. The location of the hernia suggests it could be an inguinal hernia. The inguinal canal, where this type of hernia occurs, is located in the lower abdomen on either side of the midline. The muscle that is located directly medial to the inguinal canal is the Rectus abdominis.", "answer_choice": "C. Rectus abdominis"}
